messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: The Hunger Games happen every year. The government uses the games to punish the people. This is because the people did not follow the rules. Every year, they pick one boy and one girl from each part of the country. The children are between 12 and 18 years old. They must fight in a battle. Only one person can stay alive. The chosen teenagers are called 'tributes'. A tribute is a person who has to fight in the games. All the people in the country must watch the games on TV.

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL. The word 'battle' is B1 level. This violates the non-negotiable A2 vocabulary rule. The text is not exclusively A2. While the rest of the text shows excellent simplification of structure and other vocabulary (e.g., 'survive' to 'stay alive'), this single violation constitutes a failure.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: The Hunger Games happen every year. The government uses the games to hurt the people. This is because the people did not follow the rules. Every year, they pick one boy and one girl from each part of the country. The children are between 12 and 18 years old. They must fight. Only one person can stay alive. The chosen teenagers are called 'tributes'. A tribute is a person who has to fight in the games. All the people in the country must watch the games on TV.

metadata.feedback_text: FAILED. The text violates the vocabulary rules. The word 'teenagers' is B1 level. It must be replaced with an A2 alternative like 'young people'. The use of 'children' for people up to 18 years old is imprecise. The sentence 'The chosen teenagers are called 'tributes'' uses a passive voice structure ('are called'). While common, an active form like 'People call these young people 'tributes'' is simpler and adheres more strictly to A2 standards.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: The Hunger Games happen every year. The government uses the games to hurt the people. This is because the people did not follow the rules. Every year, they pick one boy and one girl from each part of the country. The young people are between 12 and 18 years old. They must fight. Only one person can stay alive. People call these young people 'tributes'. A tribute is a person who has to fight in the games. All the people in the country must watch the games on TV.

metadata.feedback_text: PASS. This is a flawless A2 text. The vocabulary is strictly A1/A2. Complex concepts like 'punished for rebelling' are perfectly simplified to 'hurt the people... because the people did not follow the rules'. The C1 keyword 'tributes' is correctly introduced and then immediately defined using simple A2 language. Sentence structure is simple and clear. No errors.
